reviewText: I love everything to do with history especially history
I have watched it all the way through its a great show and I enjoy it.
It is an exellent movie i would say it one of the best history chennel movie you can get

This is the most openly propagandist bulls*** I have ever watched. There is no context - no the fact these shooters were all in a war where there was a draft where you actually had to not be stupid and fat to qualify to go to the jungle. This is the show the government needs you to watch show if you're a) stupid: you volunteer! b) You're poor and think you'll get out before you see action, you get college!; c) You;re a or b and die for something the government won't tell you about, but are willing to let you die for.

You can get this for $19.99 over on shop.history.com, it is decent with a few normal problems that always seem to show up in History channel productions. I gave it 4 stars for the stories that are told. Overall it's enjoyable with mostly good info and stories.

This is a very interesting DVD, especially for me as I was an investigator on one of the missions that was re-enacted.  The DVD is a great view for all those that are familiar with sniper missions or have an interest in them.  The re-enactment I saw on the case that I investigated was spot on!

For the lovers of snipper stories it is simply the best.
A praise to Carlos Hathcock and his unique ability.
Recommend without a doubt.

Love this DVD, great gift for any shooter! This DVD tells the amazing stories/re-enactment of the long range shots that formed our history!
Thanks!
I really like this documentary film , it was very entertaining and informative, it also had some good exciting recreations of sniping adventures.
